problem.markdown:
Which of the following is true? (x) Google developed its own programming language to hide machine failures ( ) iPhones are programmed using Java ( ) Web search algorithms use only integer arithmetic, not floating point (real) numbers ( ) Scientific computing is done mostly using "Vector Supercomputers" ( ) All of the above
[explanation] a. You've seen this already ... it's called MapReduce. TRUE!
b. is false ... iOS devices are programmed in ObjectiveC, not Java.
c. is false ... search algorithms certainly do use floating point numbers to find similarities of your query with the results they've cached.
d. is false ... it's mostly done using cluster computing (with GPUs more and more), not exotic vector supercomputer hardware. [explanation]
